summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center memorandum detailing the response to a medical emergency involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. It describes staff finding Epstein unresponsive in his cell, performing CPR, and transporting him to the hospital.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The unresponsive inmate found in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, who was administered CPR and transported to the hospital.

events.title: Medical Emergency and Hospital Transport of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A medical emergency call was announced for inmate Jeffrey Epstein in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. He was found unresponsive, and medical staff performed CPR while transporting him to the hospital.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the morning of August 10, 2019.
A medical emergency call was announced at approximately 6:33am.
Medical staff performed CPR on Epstein continuously during transport from his cell to the hospital.
Epstein was transported via ambulance to Downtown Beekman hospital with BOP staff escort.
The document is a first-hand account from a senior officer specialist who responded to the emergency.
